sentences.sentence: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallis vows to keep the pressure on Russia after her reform party secures first place in parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Fighting intensifies in the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut while life in the region for civilians has grown increasingly difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Celebrations among supporters of Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Her reform party has secured first place in Sunday's parliamentary election with 31.6%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kallus said the election leaves the party in a strong position to form a coalition government that will keep the pressure on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We have to do major reforms regarding green transition for example but we also have to invest in our security. Our aggressive neighbor has not vanished and will not vanish so we have to work with that. Callas had faced a challenge from the far-right populist Ekri party which wants to limit the Baltic nation's exposure to the Ukraine crisis and blames the current government for Estonia's high inflation rates we've had the highest inflation in Europe we've had the biggest drop in living standards the biggest drop in economics so we are very rapidly moving into a very multi-pronged crisis in Estonia.

sentences.sentence: In order to stay in power, reform will again have to form a coalition with one or more of the parties that entered the Baltic states' 101-seat parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia claims it is tightening its hold on the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut with constant pounding on the main routes in and out of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces still control Bakhmut, but a top commander described the situation as hell, although his forces claim to have stabilized the front lines on the outskirts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Kyiv's troops were in a, quote, painful and difficult battle in the eastern Donbass region, including Bakhmut. For the civilians in the region, life has grown increasingly difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: People are forced to cook in the street, many of them living in basements without electricity, heating or water. Moscow appears determined to seize Bakhmut as part of its wider aim of capturing the entire Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But both sides say they are running out of ammunition.

sentences.sentence: In a once-in-a-generation move, more than 100 countries have agreed to a UN treaty to protect the high seas,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: a body of water that covers nearly half of the planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: the high seas, a body of water that covers nearly half of the planet. Good evening-ish ladies and gentlemen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The agreement marks 15 years in negotiations and it's directed at international waters that are not currently under the control or protection of nations. And while the treaty still needs to be formally adopted, campaigners are already praising the move. Once enacted, it will create a new body to manage the conservation of ocean life and delineate protected zones in the high seas. It will also knit together different regional treaties, paving the way for conservation efforts to better protect a number of marine species, including dolphins, sea turtles and many fish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz welcoming European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen to the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She was invited to a closed meeting of the cabinet on Sunday, just days after a decision on phasing out combustion engines was postponed because of German demands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Von der Leyen said it was important to invest in the clean energy sector in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We must focus on the fact that we will be the leading region in the clean technologies in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We must improve the framework conditions the clean tech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: She said the EU was engaged in constructive dialogue with Germany about the controversial plans to ban the production of the internal combustion engines in vehicles by 2035.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: von der Leyen added that while there was full support for the principle of technological openness, it must be balanced with the EU's climate policy goals. She's due to meet with US President Joe Biden next Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of protesters took to the streets of Athens on Sunday over the deadly

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: train crash in Larissa, which killed at least 57 people, mainly students. Tear gas and stun grenades were used when violent clashes broke out between police and demonstrators outside the Greek parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The crowds gathered after calls by rail workers and public sector employees to express their grief and anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Flowers were laid on the tracks at a railway station in northern Greece to honour the victims of those who died in the tragedy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A massive fire hit a crammed refugee camp for Rohingya Muslims in southern Bangladesh on Sunday, leaving thousands homeless.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A fire official at the camp in Cox's Bazar said that no casualties have been reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The UNHCR in Bangladesh tweeted that it's providing support. More than 700,000 Rohingya Muslims fled to Bangladesh from Myanmar in 2017 when the military launched a brutal crackdown. The United States has called Myanmar's oppression of the Rohingya a genocide.

sentences.sentence: The hike comes at a moment when President Xi Jinping's ties with Joe Biden are under strain over the war in Ukraine, the possible invasion of Taiwan and the recent spy balloon saga. U.S. President Joe Biden has paid tribute to the heroes of Bloody Sunday in Selma, Alabama.

sentences.sentence: The United States Tennis Association and the US Open are hopeful that Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic will be allowed into the US to compete in the upcoming tournaments in India Wells and Miami.
